        About this item

        • LEAVE THE PAIN BEHIND: Doctor Butler’s hemorrhoid ointment and anorectal lidocaine cream was developed by a Board Certified Proctologist to ensure our ingredients offer the best hemorrhoid treatment for women and men.
        • LIDOCAINE NUMBING CREAM: This hemorrhoid relief and fissure treatment formula works as a numbing cream for rapid relief from hemorrhoids. Our hemorrhoids cream also features Phenylephrine, a vasoconstrictor to help reduce swelling.
        • HEAL, SOOTHE and PROTECT: Discover instant relief with this paraben free hemorrhoidal cream that also features herbs, essential oils and minerals, and amino acids for added healing solutions. Aloe vera extract, ginseng extract and horse chestnut offer further benefits with skin protectant properties for external hemorrhoid care.*
        • LEADING HEMORRHOIDS TREATMENT: Join more than 200,000 satisfied new customers who purchased Doctor Butler’s hemorrhoid products for multi symptom relief over this year. Feel the relief of fissures and hemorrhoid pain, discomfort, burning, itching and swelling.*
        • MADE IN THE USA: Doctor Butler’s ointments, creams, and sprays are manufactured in the USA under rigorous quality controls to ensure the safe & effective use of all our products. We have also partnered with Leaping Bunny to maintain cruelty free standards across our brand.

        How customer reviews and ratings work

        Customer Reviews, including Product Star Ratings help customers to learn more about the product and decide whether it is the right product for them.

        To calculate the overall star rating and percentage breakdown by star, we don’t use a simple average. Instead, our system considers things like how recent a review is and if the reviewer bought the item on Amazon. It also analyzed reviews to verify trustworthiness.

        Sam Baize
        5.0 out of 5 stars If you're in pain, and you're hesitant to drop the cash on this - just do it. Trust me.
        Reviewed in the United States on May 22, 2019
        Style: A - 1 oz. TubeVerified Purchase
        So, butt reviews. Everyone loves these. But I'll assume that if you're reading this right now, you're in a similar situation that I was in. For me, I had pretty much exhausted every other source of relief for my chronic hemorrhoids and anal fissure. Other hemorrhoid creams worked okay at reducing the swelling, but they often stung when applied and they did very little to help the pain substantially. It was getting... pretty ridiculous, I must say.

        I changed my diet, started taking fiber supplements, avoid fatty foods, and I invested in just about EVERYTHING under the sun to keep my toosh happy. Wet wipes? Got 'em. Witch hazel wipes? Got those too. The standard prep H? But of course - the regular, extra pain relief, and itching relief varieties. I even installed a bidet on my toilet just to cut down on wiping time because I was literally in just THAT much pain.

        I'd been like this for months, and while I can stand the pain, there was something that came along even worse than that - itching. I... almost have no words to describe just how terribly I started itching, every night when I went to bed. I tried sitz baths, itch creams, home remedies - nothing. The itching wasn't even the worst part! The real problem was that I couldn't resist scratching, and oh god, I scratched my poor toosh raw. It was just terrible all around.

        So I was in some EXTREME pain by the time I ultimately pulled up Amazon in search of relief, and my real key motivation was just to stop the itching because that was just adding to the pain that was already there. I was miserable and when I first saw this product, good reviews aside, it was nearly $30 for a little tube of gel. Sorry to say, but I was skeptical! What made this product so much different than the others I'd tried?

        But... I read the reviews. Because I was desperate. And people made some mighty claims...

        It hurt me to pay 30 bucks for this, but in the end, I figured it couldn't hurt as badly as the pain I was already in, right?

        And just... I'm so thankful that I pulled the trigger. So thankful that I'm taking the time to write up this review, so others can hear my testimony and hopefully, if they're in a similar boat, choose to take the plunge as well.

        So, without further ado, onto the actual product! The tube is pretty small, unfortunately, but when I checked and compared it to the prep H I had, it was actually the same weight! I was pretty surprised, because this seemed to go by so much faster - I realized that was probably because I was using it pretty extensively compared to the other creams, because this gel actually WORKED.

        The very first thing I noticed after applying this (there is an applicator, but it bothered me, so I just use my finger to apply it gently in and around the "edges", if you will) was that there was little to no sting, despite how rubbed raw I was at the time. That was a nice relief.

        The second thing I noticed was just how FAST it worked. The pain? Gone in a matter of minutes. Like, it literally numbs the area. I was so blissed out I was ready to cry, I'm not even kidding you. And the itch? Gone just as fast. In under five minutes, I had no urge to itch anymore. And the rest is pretty much history.

        Now, I'll admit that I use this product fairly liberally. I apply a small, pea sized amount anywhere between one and three times per day (usually closer to three if we're being realistic), once after every bowel movement. Because of that, this product only lasted me just over a month. I just ordered my second tube (goodbye money, I knew thee well) and I have no regrets. I think of it this way - let's say this lasts me exactly one month. At the current price (at the time of this review, May 2019) of $28.34, I'm paying less than $1 per day to be free and clear of pain and itching, and BM's are SIGNIFICANTLY less troublesome. Is that worth it? Well, to me, it definitely is. For you? Well, that's something you'll have to take into consideration, but again, if you're in pain and you've tried the other stuff, I strongly urge you to give this a chance. And if you need to, like me, you can subscribe and save a couple bucks each time you re-order it.

        Now, my issue isn't going away - I'm actually due to have surgery in the near future, so for the time being, I'll be using this. Maybe after my surgery I won't need it as much, which would be nice, but chances are that unless you're REALLY bad like I am, you probably won't go flying through this quite as fast. Just another thing to take into consideration.

        [ Pros ]
        - Comes with a neat little applicator (albeit I don't use mine, the option is there)
        - The gel (similar consistency to Neosporin, maybe a bit thicker) doesn't burn, even on raw and irritated skin
        - The gel numbs the area VERY well, and pain is literally gone in a matter of minutes
        - The gel also takes away the itch (no matter how intense!) in again just a matter of minutes

        [ Cons ]
        - You get a fairly small amount for what you're paying for, BUT it goes a long way in the end and does what it needs to do, so this con is ruled out for me, personally, when compared with all the pros!

        I pray that you all find total toosh happiness. uwu

        Hi, I am not syre what other reviewers are talking about regarding the vendor promising a free product for a 5-star review. I have the email with Word attachment right here before me and no such promises are made. I purchased this product and received it recently. The other product I purchased for my issues I received 2 days ago. This is a hemorrhoid ointment so why would anyone in the world want another one free if it does not work. That sounds ridiculous. I have two thrombosed hemorrhoids and actually had been in excruciating pain for almost 2 weeks. I thought it was an abscess and had to see a colon surgeon prior to the new year. Dr. said I had two thrombosed hemorrhoids with some painful characteristics that I won't described as it's TMI. Nonetheless, the pain was debilitating and I was told it would probably resolve itself within a week and the blood clots would be reabsorbed by my body. Well I was not too thrilled about that considering I was hoping for immediate relief. I already had a prescription ointment that my GI doctor had prescribed that was somewhat helping, nothing worth writing home about. So I was desperate and checked Amazon. Just as a backstory, I had been recovering from a back injury (herniated disc -2 months of bedrest) and as soon as I recovered from the back with an epidural steroid injection this thing struck so I have been pretty miserable not being able to function like a regular human being. I ordered a natural hemorrhoid supplement and this product. I have to say in all honesty that even though the hemorrhoids are quite visible and one of them is open and still bleeding the pain has subsided significantly within only a few days allowing me to function. Within immediate use of the ointment I have felt relief. It is much better than Preparation H which does nothing for me. I find this product to be much better for me, but again I can only speak for myself. Some people have indicated relief for only five 10 or 15 minutes but I put it on over an hour ago and I still feel relief. I will update after my issue resolves but based on my experience I already like this product very much. In the email I received from the seller, the instructions are very clear and what they ask in regards to reviews, as all buyers should consider when they buy a product, is prior to leaving a negative review to please consider all of the options of what could have gone wrong whether it is a sensitivity, and so forth. They also offer a full money back guarantee and ask that you contact them with any issues.         4.0 out of 5 stars Works decently well on internal hemorrhoids
        Reviewed in the United States on April 28, 2023
        Style: A - 1 oz. TubeVerified Purchase
        I don't have external hemorrhoids - only internal ones which, once in a great while, prolapse and cause me remarkable pain. During a flareup, the internal ones are just vaguely uncomfortable, giving the feeling of what is called "incomplete evacuation". Normally a flare-up lasts about two weeks. I do not experience itching in either case.

        I decided to try this to see if I could accelerate the healing process. I've tried it on both a prolapsed internal and a typical internal hemorrhoid flare up. The the former case, it didn't do much. This is not altogether surprising; not much outside of NSAIDs helps the prolapsed type. In the latter case, I've tried it when I was having bleeding, and when I wasn't. It helped in both cases to alleviate some of the discomfort, but I'm not 100% certain that it shortened the flareup at all.

        The applicator on this is very useful. I recommend it over using finger cots, since the applicator is narrow, has apertures along its length, and can apply the ointment liberally without pulling much out when it is removed. After I use it, I squeeze out a bit extra ointment, wipe the applicator clean with tissue, spray it down with 99% IPA, and stored it in a latex finger cot for the next time. I do this so I don't need to re-prime it every time, which would waste the bulk of the ointment.

        That's about it - it lubricates and numbs a bit. When I have the flareups I use stool softeners and sometimes 1-2 tsp of mineral oil per day, along with my usual 2x10g of psyllium fiber. This, more than anything, reduces the flareup duration since it helps avoid further aggravation of the veins. However, I would recommend this as an additional measure to help things get back to normal.
